Christian Kohlschuetter wrote:

> Hi,
>
> is there are specific reason why Heritrix does not make use of HTTP 
> keep-alive
> connections? Especially for host-based queuing, this could significantly
> improve performance. 

Using HTTP/1.0 makes our life easier (smile).  The client doesn't need 
to worry about reconstituting the chunked responses. 

But this feature has been asked for in the past -- recently even -- and 
there's an issue to cover investigation of whats involved: 
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=73833&atid=539102&func=detail&aid=896805.  
It just hasn't been considered a priority.

> I also think that the current
> MultiThreadedConnectionManager does not make much sense if connections 
> will
> not be reused anyway.

Yes. 

We used to have a single-connection manager before the update to 
httpclient 3.0.  I was under the impression that the MTCM did socket 
recycling. This 'fact' and issues I was having around delays on socket 
close made me move to MTCM.  But then Gordon recently pointed out there 
seems to be no socket recycling going on.
